title: Some customers cannot create channels that contain a dash or an underscore in the name

notes.body:
Issue Summary:

On August 28, 2019 at 10:01 a.m. PDT a change was released which unexpectedly prevented some customers from being able to create channels. Specifically, if the channel name included a hyphen or underscore.

An update was made to ensure channel names with such characters were validated correctly, and by August 29 at 12:33 p.m. PDT channel creation was functioning as expected once again.
We’re happy to report that you should now be able to create channels that contain a hyphen or underscore in the name without any trouble! We apologize for the disruption.
We are still looking into channel name issues with channel creation but we hope we are nearing a fix. Thanks for your patience!
We're seeing report of users having intermittent trouble with creating channel names. We're investigating and will follow up when we know more.

Issue Summary: 

On August 30, 2019, beginning at 3:04 p.m. PDT, we received reports that some Enterprise Grid customers were unable to connect to Slack. Upon investigation, we identified that a large spike in requests was causing the symptoms of degraded access and degraded search in Slack. To fix the issue, we rolled back recent updates causing the increased load. The issue was fully resolved at 4:29 p.m. PDT.
We've got good news: we're in the clear and everyone should be able to connect again. We're sorry for any trouble this caused. Thanks for sticking with us.
We're seeing some positive signs and people should be able to connect again. However, if you're still having issues, please let us know at feedback@slack.com.
We’ve heard reports that some people are experiencing degraded service or have trouble connecting to Slack. We're sorry for any disruption this has caused to your day.
Some people may be having an issue with Slack. We’re currently investigating and will have more information shortly. Thank you for your patience.

Issue Summary:

On October 7, 2019 at 6:36 p.m. PDT, we identified a change that inadvertently impacted the posts feature. As a result, customers were unable to open or create new posts in Slack. After reverting these changes, full functionality was restored to posts and the issue was resolved at 9:56 p.m. PDT.
We’ve restored the functionality to posts and things are back to normal. Sorry for the trouble, and thank you for your patience with us.
We’ve started to see improvements when creating and opening posts, but we’re still monitoring this closely. We’ll let you know when this feature has been completely restored.
We’re still looking into the issue with posts — we’ll provide new information as soon as it’s available. Thanks for bearing with us.
Some people are having trouble creating and opening posts. We’re currently investigating and will share more information as soon as we have an update. We're sorry for the disruption.

We are aware of an issue with Brazilian time zone settings that are affecting notifications, reminders, time stamps and other elements in Slack. Our engineers are coordinating to solve the issue. Thank you for your patience as we investigate!

Some of our Enterprise Grid customers are having trouble accessing Slack workspaces in our desktop apps. We're currently looking into the cause, and we'll keep you posted as soon as we have more information. For those affected, access to Slack is still available through a web browser. We're sorry for the disruption to your day.
We're looking into reports of issues with creating posts for some Enterprise Grid customers. Thanks for your patience as we look into this.
Some customers may be experiencing server errors or messages failing to send in the desktop app. We're very sorry for the trouble and we're working to get things back to normal.
Some people may be having an issue with Slack. We’re currently investigating and will have more information shortly. Thank you for your patience.
Some customers may be experiencing issues configuring SAML SSO. We are investigating and we're very sorry for the disruption.

Some of our customers are having trouble inviting Guest accounts. In particular, this appears to be affecting our Enterprise Grid customers. We're currently investigating the cause and we'll keep you updated on new information. We're sorry for the disruption.
Google Drive thumbnails for new and recently uploaded files are now visible in Slack. We'll be back with an update on the thumbnails that are still missing. Thanks for your patience.
Google Drive thumbnails aren't displaying in Slack. We're sorry for the trouble, and we'll keep you posted here.
We’re glad to report all issues with the Admin stats page and Workspace Directory have been resolved. Apologies for the disruption we caused, and thank you for your patience.
We’re investigating issues with the Admin stats page and Workspace Directory for Grid customers. We’re looking into the cause and will provide new information as soon as it’s available.
Some people may be having an issue with Slack. We’re currently investigating and will have more information shortly. Thank you for your patience.
We are working hard to identify the cause of the issue. We will be back with more information in 30 minutes.
Some customers may be having trouble loading Slack or parts of the Slack interface. We're very sorry for the disruption and we have all hands on deck as we investigate. Thank you for bearing with us.
We’ve resolved the issue with some features failing to load and Slack is back to full functionality. We’re sorry for the disruption this has caused.
Our team continues to work to get full functionality restored as soon as possible. No additional information to share just yet, but we’ll keep you posted as soon we have an update.
We're continuing to look into this issue and work towards a fix. Thank you again for bearing with us in the meantime.

Upon further investigation, we've also found that this issue may be causing issues with installing apps or integrations in Slack. We'll continue to keep you in the loop as more information becomes available.
We're still hard at work investigating a fix for this issue. We're sorry about the continued trouble and we'll let you know once we have more information to share.

Some users may be experiencing issues with various features in Slack, including app, channel, and user names not displaying as expected. We're aware of the source of the issue, and we have a team of engineers dedicated to fixing this as soon as possible. We'll keep you posted as we make progress towards a fix.
Some people may be having an issue with Slack. We’re currently investigating and will have more information shortly. Thank you for your patience.

We're looking into reports of access issues for some people using web browsers. Please hold tight. In the meantime, using a different type of web browser or the desktop app will hopefully get you back into your workspace.

Issue Summary: 

On March 30, 2020 from 3:20 p.m. to 6:26 p.m. PDT, some customers may have experienced elevated API response times or timeouts. This was caused by an issue with a third-party provider. Once they resolved the issue, Slack API response times returned to normal.

Customers should no longer be experiencing elevated API response times or timeouts. Thank you for being patient with us, we appreciate it. 

If you have any further issues, please reach out to us at feedback@slack.com.

Issues with a third-party provider are causing elevated response times in the API, leading to potential timeouts. We are monitoring the situation and working to mitigate this from our end as best we can. We apologize for the disruption.

We’re still investigating the issue with these delayed or failed actions, and we've discovered that this may be affecting searching in Slack as well. We'll confirm as soon as things are working as they should be.

Some of our customers are having trouble completing certain user-related actions, such as when deactivating members. We're currently investigating the cause of these delays, and we'll keep you posted as soon as we have more information. We're sorry for the disruption.

We've been seeing improvements to the performance of accounts with Enterprise Key Management enabled though we are still investigating the root cause. Thank you for your patience as we get to the bottom of this.

Some customers with Enterprise Key Management enabled may be experiencing issues when trying to read or write messages. We’re looking into it and will provide another update as soon as it’s available.
Some people may be having an issue with Slack. We’re currently investigating and will have more information shortly. Thank you for your patience.
We have resolved the issue and everyone should be able to connect to Slack once more. We're very sorry for the disruption and we appreciate you bearing with us.
Users should start to see improvements and be able to connect again. We will provide another update as soon as the issue is fully resolved. Thank you for your patience.

Upon further investigation this issue is not exclusive to Android devices. Some users are unable to automatically receive new messages and may notice a grey banner on desktop. We’ll provide an update as soon as it’s available.
Some Android users have reported difficulty logging into Slack. We are investigating and will provide an update as soon as we know more.
Some people may be having an issue with Slack. We’re currently investigating and will have more information shortly. Thank you for your patience.

Information on the Analytics dashboard (https://my.slack.com/stats) is not up to date. We are currently investigating this issue and will be back as soon as we have more news to share. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused in the meantime.
We're still working towards a solution for this issue. We'll return back here with an update when we have more news to share on a fix.
We've identified the likely cause of this issue and we're now exploring possible fixes. Thank you for your continued patience as we work to get things fixed up.
We're continuing to look into the issue causing custom emoji to not appear for some customers. We're sorry for the trouble and will continue to keep you posted.
Our team is investigating an issue that is causing custom emoji to go missing from some workspaces. We'll keep you updated as soon as we have more information.

Some Android users may notice that new messages are not showing up in channels and DMs immediately. We're actively investigating this issue and will keep you posted as more information becomes available. For now, quitting and reopening the Slack app should allow new messages to load. We're sorry for any disruption this brings to your day.
We're investigating problems with search indexing. In the meantime, people might notice some messages and files not showing up in search results. We apologize for the inconvenience.
Some users might notice that their notifications settings for mobile are not being respected. We are taking a look and hope to have more news soon.

We're currently aware of some intermittent latency and timeouts with image attachments, certain API methods (including users.setPhoto, chat.postMessage and chat.update, views.*), and apps which use these features. We are currently investigating and will update when we believe these issues have been resolved. Sorry for the inconvenience.
Some users and app developers are currently seeing "Request failed with status code 400" errors when apps submit requests.  We are looking into this and will post when we have more information.

We've determined this issue is only impacting confirmation emails sent after clicking an invite link to join a workspace, while other emails are working as intended. We'll continue to keep you posted as we work towards a fix. 

For now, we recommend sending invitations directly via email, rather than sharing invite links with invitees.

Some customers may be unable to receive emails from Slack. We're currently investigating this issue, and we'll let you know as soon as we have more information. We apologize for the inconvenience in the meantime.

We've received some reports of folks being suddenly signed out of Slack on desktop, and we're investigating this issue further. We apologize for any disruption this may have caused and will let you know once we have more details.

Some users are unable to sign in to Slack using Google SSO. This issue appears to be isolated to desktop at this time. We're working to get things back to normal as quickly as possible, and we apologize for the disruption.

Issue Summary:
From September 8, 2020 at 7:33 p.m. PDT until September 10, 2020 at 11:59 p.m. PDT, some customers saw a “Page not available” error message when trying to sign into Slack using Google Auth SSO.

Upon investigation, we identified an error in an update we made to how we handle SSO authentication errors. We reverted the change which resolved the issue for all affected users.

We've restored full functionality so that anyone using Google SSO to login to Slack should now be able to successfully access their Slack workspace(s). If you continue to have issues signing in with Google SSO, please let us know at feedback@slack.com. 

We appreciate you bearing with us and our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this caused.

We've identified the problem and made a fix that we expect to resolve this issue. We are seeing steady improvements, but we're continuing to monitor this closely as a small number of customers may still be encountering trouble signing in to Slack using Google SSO at the moment.

We'll be back with an update once we can confirm the issue is fully resolved.

Some users have reported issues with imports and exports failing to complete at this time. We're working to resolve the issue and will share more information as soon as it’s available. Thank you for your patience.

We've confirmed the issue with Org Owners and Admins being unable to edit user profiles is now fixed. Please refresh with Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + R, and let us know if anything seems unresolved.

Apologies for any disruptions to your work. We'll report back with a summary shortly.
We’re still investigating the issue, however we've encountered a delay in reaching a possible solution. We’ll provide another update as soon as we have news.
We’ve identified a potential cause of the issue and we’re working on getting a fix out as soon as possible. We’ll be back with another update.

Some Org Owners and Admins on Enterprise Grid might have trouble editing user profiles through the Admin dashboard. We're investigating the issue, and we believe that this is a result of a recent change made on our end. If this is the case, we'll be reverting the change shortly. We'll follow up when we know more.

The fix has been fully released and all images should now display correctly after reloading Slack via Ctrl/Command+Shift+O. Our sincere thanks for bearing with us and we're very sorry for any disruption this may have caused.

We're making progress towards a total fix, but new image uploads going forward should render as expected. Work is ongoing to fix the images that were affected during this incident.

You're welcome to re-upload images that were previously affected if you need them before the complete fix is ready.

No additional news to share just yet, but we're working as quickly as possible to identify and fix the issue of recently uploaded images not displaying properly on desktop. We appreciate your continued patience.
Newly uploaded images should display correctly on mobile devices, but we're still digging into why they're not rendering correctly on the desktop application. Thanks for bearing with us.

Some customers may see broken or empty placeholder images after they try to upload an image to a channel. We're looking into it and shall provide an update as we know more. Our apologies for the disruption.
We don't have any new information to share at the moment. We'll be back with an update as soon as we do. Thank you for your patience.
Our investigation of the RTM API issue is still ongoing. We will provide another update in 30 minutes.
No additional news to share at this stage, but we’re focused on getting things back to normal as quickly as possible. We’ll be back with another update in 30 minutes.

Some customers may be experiencing trouble processing messages with the RTM API, including issues interacting with apps and bots. We apologise for the disruption. We are investigating and will work to resolve this as fast as we can.

Issue summary:
On May 11, 2020, we began investigating cases of Android users missing new messages in the mobile app. After more reports trickled in, we escalated the issue further on our side on June 1, 2020.

We pushed out several changes to the mobile app to help mitigate the issue; however, these changes may not resolve the trouble for all affected users. We'll continue investigating any reports of users not seeing new messages in the mobile app.

Our engineers have narrowed down the issues that are causing some new messages to not appear in our Android app. While these issues are not fully resolved yet, going forward we'll continue working on this as a bug that we'll track internally. If you're still experiencing this behaviour, please reach out to us at feedback@slack.com.

While affected users should still be able to search in Slack, recent updates, such as new messages, may not immediately appear in the results. We'll let you know once the issue is resolved, and we'll follow-up if the situation changes.

Affected users should be able to search and see the most optimal results. However, we're still working on this issue. We'll let you know if the situation changes, and we'll follow-up once this issue is resolved.

The majority of affected users should be able to search in Slack. Some users may not see the most optimal search results, and some users may see a "Something went wrong" error when searching for files. We'll continue to work to resolve this trouble.

Note: We updated this note to mention some users could've encountered a "Something went wrong" error when searching for files, so all affected users weren't able to search in Slack at this time.
At this time, some users may be unable to search for messages and files specifically. We're working to resolve this issue, and we appreciate your patience.
Some users are unable to search in Slack. We're investigating, and we'll follow-up here once we know more. We're sorry for the trouble.

We're still investigating issues with editing user groups and transferring workspace ownership in a browser. No additional information to share just yet, but we'll keep you posted as soon as we have a further update.

We have confirmed that this issue specifically affects Slack in a web browser, and we're working to resolve this. 

In the meantime, you should be able to edit user group names from within the desktop app. You can download our desktop clients here: https://slack.com/downloads

We're sorry for the disruption.
Some people may be having an issue importing files from Google Drive. Our team is looking into this and will share more details as they are uncovered.
Our investigation of the email verification sign in glitch is still ongoing at this time. We’ll be back with another update as soon as we have news.

Some SSO users may be running into a "There's been a glitch" error screen when logging in using the email verification sign in method. In the meantime, manually entering the workspace URL in your browser address bar and then signing in should work as normal. Our team are investigating, and will share updates as soon as they are available.

Some customers using the latest version of our iOS app are seeing their messages remain marked as unread and the channels bolded even after reading the channel and navigating away. Our team are currently investigating and we'll be back with any updates as they happen.

Thank you for your patience while we looked into this. The issue with calls, Workflow Builder, and Block Kit should now be resolved.
 
Please perform a hard refresh by hitting Command + Shift + R (Mac) / Ctrl + Shift + R (Windows) to apply the fix. 

We apologize for any inconvenience caused by this issue. Please let us know if you have any further problems we can help with, or if you have any other questions or concerns.
Some users may be having trouble with calls, using Workflow builder, and using Block Kit. Our team is currently investigating and we'll be back with any updates as they happen.

We've deployed a fix and we believe this issue should now be resolved. Please reach out to us at feedback@slack.com if you have any further trouble.

Thank you for bearing with us. We'll be back with an issue summary soon.
Some customers may be experiencing errors when searching for or listing files via Slack or the API. We're very sorry for the disruption, and we're working to resolve this.

Issue summary:
On May 11, 2021 around 10:56 a.m. to 11:41 a.m. PDT, some users were unable to connect entirely or experienced degraded performance, such as channel history failing to load. Some apps making API requests may have also encountered failures, such as messages failing to send in Slack.

A hardware issue caused a problem for some of our infrastructure. The automated process that should've resolved this encountered a bug, which prevented a quick resolution. We manually replaced the failed hardware to resolve the trouble.

Note: We've updated the title to reflect the trouble affected users may have encountered. On the side of this page, we've also added additional services that may have been impacted.
We're happy to report that this issue should now be resolved. We apologize for keeping you away from your work and causing this disruption. We'll report back with an Issue Summary shortly.
We're starting to see some steady improvements and most users should be able to connect to Slack again. We'll confirm as soon as things are working as they should.

We're aware of an issue where some users may be encountering connection errors or degraded performance. Some users will be unable to connect, and some apps making API requests may encounter failures.

We're working to resolve this and will reach back out when we have more information to share.

Note: We've updated this message to clarify what affected users may have encountered and that apps making API requests may have encountered failures.

Upon further investigation we've learned that this issue is not fully resolved. We're continuing to investigate this and we will provide an update as soon as we have more information.

Thank you for your ongoing patience and apologies for the confusion.
We believe the issue should now be resolved. Users should no longer have trouble using certain apps and integrations in Slack. We'll post the summary of this issue as soon as possible.
We're still investigating the issue around using certain apps and integrations in Slack. No additional news to share just yet, but we’ll provide new information as soon as it’s available.
Our investigation is still ongoing at this time and we don’t have any new information to share just yet. We’ll be back with another update in 30 minutes.

Some customers may be experiencing issues using certain apps and integrations in Slack. Workflow Builder and other apps may be impacted. Our team is currently investigating and we'll keep you posted as soon as we have more information. We're sorry for the disruption.

Some customers may be experiencing issues with the "Slack for Gmail" add-on not being visible in Gmail. We're currently investigating and we'll provide another update as soon as we have more information to share.
We're seeing signs of improvement and continuing to evaluate. We will provide another update as soon as we have more information to share.
We are continuing to look into this issue. We'll provide another status update in 30 minutes.

We previously stated that this was only impacting Android users, but have now determined that this is occurring on both the Android and iOS mobile apps.  

Our team is working hard to resolve this issue, and we'll be in touch once we have more information to share.
We're still investigating the issue, but we don't have additional information just yet. We'll be back in 30 minutes with another update.
Some customers may be experiencing an issue where they're being logged out of Slack on their Android mobile device. We're currently investigating and will be back with an update shortly.

We're seeing some signs of improvement, and reloading Slack (Ctrl/Command + R) may allow Slack to load again. The issue is not resolved for everyone, however, and we'll be back again once we have another update to share.

Note: We've edited the title of this incident to accurately reflect the scope of this issue.
Thank you all for your patience today as we work on resolving this connection issue. We will be back with a final update once the issues have been resolved.

We are aware of connectivity issues related to DNS that are impacting a small subset of users. This issue was caused by our own change and not related to any third-party DNS software and services. In order to resolve this faster, your ISP (Internet Service Provider) will need to flush their DNS record for slack.com. Please reach out to your networking team to provide them with this information.
We expect all customers’ connectivity issues to be resolved within the next 24 hours. We know how important it is for people to stay connected and we apologize for this disruption.
Our investigation of this connection issue is still ongoing at this time. We’ll be back with another update and apologize for this disruption. Thank you for your continued patience here!

We are continuing to investigate the connection issue and will keep you posted as soon as we have more information available. We apologize for any disruption this has caused and thank you for your continued patience.
We are still digging in to this connection issue and we will keep you up to date as more information becomes available. Thank you for your patience today.

We continue to investigate this connection issue and we’ll continue to keep you posted as soon as we have more information. Thanks for your patience and we apologize for any disruption this may have caused.
We’re currently investigating this connection issue and we’ll keep you posted as soon as we have more information. Thanks for your patience and we apologize for the disruption.

Issue summary:
On October 27, 2021 from around 5:47 a.m. to 2:24 p.m. PDT, some users may have experienced difficulties receiving two-factor authentication (2FA) codes from our SMS service provider, preventing them from signing into Slack.

We monitored the situation until the problem was resolved and the affected users were able to receive the codes again.
The issue is now be resolved and customers should receive 2FA codes normally.

Our SMS service provider is currently experiencing high filtering on SMS towards the AT&T network in the United States. We recommend using your backup codes, switching to an Authentication app, or reaching out to your Admins to temporarily disable 2FA for you.
We're still investigating, but don't have any new information yet. We'll provide another update once we have more to share.

Some Enterprise Grid customers are seeing messages temporarily disappear. Refreshing (Ctrl / Command + Shift + R) may resurface the messages, but affected users may need to refresh more than once during the day. 

We're sorry for the trouble. We're investigating, and we'll report back once we have next steps.
Thank you for your patience. The issue has been resolved. Customers should no longer have any trouble signing in on the desktop app. We’re sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused.
Some users are unable to sign in on the desktop app. We're investigating and will have more information to share in 30 minutes. Our apologies for the disruption.
We're still monitoring the situation and will post updates as they become available.
Thanks again for your patience as we continue to investigate outbound email and file download failures.
Our investigation is ongoing. We'll be back with another update in 30 minutes.

We appreciate your patience while we continue to address these issues.

We're also continuing to investigate file download failures, although this is only expected to impact a small number of users.

We are still working to address the issues with outbound email failures.
A small number of file downloads may be failing, this remains part of our investigation.

We are continuing to look into reports of outbound email failures. If you're awaiting a confirmation code for login, manually signing in with email address and password will work in the interim. 

We're also monitoring issues with downloading files.
We're investigating failures in sending outbound emails including invitations, confirmation codes for workspace creation, email notifications.

We've identified the source of the issue and we're working on a fix. Refreshing the page continues to help as a temporary workaround. 

Thank you very much for bearing with us

We're investigating reports that Slack sign up/join redirect may not be working for some users. A temporary workaround is to refresh either of those pages and on the second time, it will load. 

We're investigating now and will be back with more information as soon as it's available, or in 30 minutes.
We are continuing to investigate issues with receiving 2FA codes when the language is set to Korean. Customers using English should be receiving 2FA codes correctly. Our apologies for the disruption.

Some customers in Korea aren't receiving 2FA codes set to Korean, or they may be receiving 2FA codes with garbled text.

We're investigating now and will be back with more information as soon as it's available, or in 30 minutes.
While we have deployed a fix, some customers may continue to appear in a huddle once a huddle has ended.  We are continuing to investigate this issue and will keep you updated.
We've deployed a fix, and customers should no longer be experiencing this issue. If you continue to have any trouble, please let us know via feedback@slack.com
We are still investigating the huddles issue that's causing the huddles status to remain as well as the inability to join new huddles.
Some users may be unable to initiate new huddles in addition to appearing on previous huddles after they have left. We're investigating this issue and we thank you for your continued patience.
Some users may appear to still be on a huddle once the huddle has ended. We’re investigating the issue and will be back with an update shortly. Thank you for your patience.

We’re continuing to work towards resolving this issue for the very small number of users who are still impacted. We appreciate your continued patience, and will let you know as soon as we have another update to share.

Most users should now be seeing signs of improvement, but we're still working towards a full resolution. We'll be back with another update as soon as the issue is resolved. Thanks for bearing with us.

Some teams that have recently initiated a free trial are experiencing delays in accessing the full suite of benefits included in a trial of our paid plans. We are working on getting this resolved as soon as possible.
We continue to work on releasing a fix and we'll share an update as soon as it's available. Thank you for your patience.

We’ve identified the cause of this bug and we’re working on getting a fix out as soon as possible. We’ll be back with another update in 30 minutes. As a workaround, you can continue to sign in manually using URL/email/password.

A bug is impacting some Android users on version 22.01.10 who try to use a magic link to sign in. Engineers have identified the issue and are working on a fix. As a workaround, you can sign in manually using URL/email/password.

This issue should now be resolved and we are currently working with customers who have reported that their channels did not automatically reconnect after re-upgrading to a paid plan to re-establish those connections. 

If your team recently downgraded to a free plan, then resubscribed to a paid tier and observed Slack Connect channels not reconnecting, you can choose to manually reconnect those channels or reach out to our support team at feedback@slack.com for assistance.
We've identified the root cause behind the issue and are working on getting things back to normal. We'll have another update as soon as we have any further information to share.
We are continuing to dig into this issue with Slack Connect channels not connecting properly. We apologize for the inconvenience in the meantime.
We are still investigating why some Slack Connect channels are having trouble reconnecting after an upgrade. Thank you for bearing with us.
Some workspaces are having trouble reconnecting their Slack Connect channels immediately after upgrading their plan. We're investigating and will let you know as soon as we know more.

As we continue to investigate this issue we wanted to quickly note that toggling the "Notify me about replies to threads I'm following" in your "Notifications" settings should help as a workaround. Thank you for your patience as we work through this one!

Some users are unexpectedly receiving banner notifications for replies in threads they're following when the preference to receive them was not previously enabled. We're investigating and will let you know as soon as we know more.

We have resolved the underlying issue for this incident and no further users will be impacted going forward.

Users previously impacted by this issue may still find the "Notify me about replies to threads I'm following" preference changed from what was previously selected. To remedy this, please go to Preferences > Notifications and update this preference if needed.

Some users have been unexpectedly receiving banner notifications for replies in threads they're following when the preference to receive them was not previously enabled. We've released a change, and believe that no additional users will be impacted by this issue. However, we are continuing to monitor the situation and will report back once we have another update.

Please be aware that users previously impacted by this issue may find their "Notify me about replies to threads I'm following" preference changed from what was selected previously. We recommend heading to Preferences > Notifications and toggling this preference if needed.

Issue summary: 
From 7:15 AM PST until 9:15 AM PST on February 2, 2022, some users were unable to use the post feature. 

This was caused by a code change. We reverted this change, restoring post functionality.

This has now been resolved and posts should be loading as expected. Please reload Slack using Cmd/Ctrl + Shift + R in order for the fix to be reflected on your end. We apologize for the inconvenience.
Users may still experience posts not loading or loading in a loop. Our team is continuing to look into this and we’ll share more information soon.
Some users may experience posts not loading or loading in a continuous loop. Our team is looking into this now and we’ll share more information soon.
Some customers may be experiencing issues using slash commands. We have identified the cause, and are working on a fix.

We've resolved the issue related to sending/composing messages in Safari. Safari users may need to reload any active Slack tabs (Cmd/Ctrl + Shift + R) or quit and relaunch their browser for the fix to come into effect. 

Thanks for bearing with us and we apologize for the disruption.
We are continuing to look into this issue when sending/composing messages on Safari. We apologize for the inconvenience and will provide more updates as new information becomes available.

We're continuing to investigate the errors when sending/composing messages on Safari.

We'll be back with an update as soon as possible and we apologize for the disruption. This error does not impact other browsers nor our desktop and mobile applications.
Some users on Safari may be hitting an error when composing/sending messages.

Issue summary: 
From 10:37 AM PST on February 2, 2022 until 1:37 PM PST on February 4, 2022, some users were encountering an error when trying to compose or send messages in web browsers. 

We found that a variable object in the message composer code was attempting to call an action that was not defined. We resolved the issue by adding a check to the code to prevent the error state from happening. 

Note: We previously indicated this issue was limited to Safari. After further investigation, we've determined other web browsers may have been impacted as well.

We are currently investigating an issue where profile information may be failing to load for some users, resulting in blank profile pictures and missing details, such as display names. 

Given the nature of the connectivity issue, search and emoji may also be impacted. Please stay tuned for status updates as we work to resolve this.
Less than 1% of users are having trouble receiving reminders. We are continuing to look into this and will provide an update as soon as there’s news to share.
We're still investigating the reports about using reminders. We do apologize for any disruption.

From April 19, 2022 at 1:16 p.m. PDT until April 19, 2022 at 4:13 p.m PDT, some Enterprise customers may have experienced delays related to reminders, notifications and other task-related features. These issues were a caused when the Primary Owner's email address of a large load-test org was updated, which resulted in the delayed processing of Enterprise job queues.

After identifying the issue, we released a fix to resolved the job queue delays and return Enterprise job processing to normal.

We've traced the performance issues back to a job that had backed up the queue responsible for handling actions taken by users and administrators in Enterprise Grid organizations. 

The backlog of tasks have completed and all features should be working as expected, though we recommend reloading the Slack app (Cmd/Ctrl + Shift + R) just in case. Thank you for your patience.

To clear the "Slack cannot connect" message, users should try clearing cache by going to "Help" > "Troubleshooting" > "Clear Cache and Restart".

If the issue persists after or if you're unable to open the desktop app, please uninstall the Windows Store version and reinstall the Direct Download version by following these instructions:

1. Quit Slack (Ctrl + Q) and make sure there are no Slack.exe or Update.exe processes running in Task Manager.
2. On Windows 10, open the Start menu and head to Settings > Apps & features. Find Slack in the list that appears and click the option to Uninstall.
3. Open a Run dialog (Windows Key + R).
4. Enter the following path: C:\Users\%USERNAME%\AppData\Local\Packages\91750D7E.Slack_8she8kybcnzg4\LocalCache\Roaming
5. Delete the Slack folder from the directory that launches.
6. Reinstall Slack from our website: https://slack.com/downloads/windows
